intro: Ravenia baracoensis, commonly known as the Baracoensian ravenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes and is characterized by its pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, with small leaflets arranged alternately along the stems. The flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying shades of pink or white, and are followed by elongated pods containing seeds.
